bibl.title: Letter from E.L. Munson to Henry Rose Carter, February 29, 1916

div1.p: Munson writes that the Association of Military Surgeons wishes to include Carter as an editorial collaborator for the "Military Surgeon."

div1.head: Letter from E.L. Munson to Henry Rose Carter, February 29, 1916
div1.opener:
ASSOCIATION OF MILITARY SURGEONS
OF THE UNITED STATES
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM, WASHINGTON, D. C.
February 29, 1916.
Assistant Surgeon General Henry R. Carter,
United States Public Health Service,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
My dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
May the Association of Military
Surgeons have the honor of including your name
among the list of editorial collaborators for the
MILITARY SURGEON?

It is desired to make the latter thoroughly
representative of the best thought and ideals of
the Services, and no one could give it more digni-
ty and prestige in such matters than yourself. On
the part of the MILITARY SURGEON, about to be com-
pletely reorganized, it is proposed to furnish a
literary environment with which all will be more
than satisfied.

There are no duties or obligations connected
with the position other than such as you might
voluntarily care to assume, though the MILITARY
SURGEON would feel highly honored if favored with
your advice and such medico-military articles or
editorial expressions as you might be willing to
contribute.

Sincerely hoping that you will find it possi-
ble to give a favorable response, I am,
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, E. L. Munson-
Secretary-Editor.
